column4: hello everyone. which command is executed, when i press 'alt' + PrtScr?
you can use 'convert'
its an imagemagick client
i can capture a window as a picture with convert? how to do that?
i dont think it does just a window.. it takes the entire screen shot
i remember seeing something like that in its args .. but i'm not sure
infact.. they named it 'import'
not convert.. they are all part of ImageMagick.. man on it
yeah, but alt+prtscr snapshots only the acual window. it is on my system and it works, i ust want to know the command name
i thought alt_prtscr is a shortcut key for gnome-screenshot
ah ok.. thank you
in future. ps ux
what do you mean by that?
`ps ux`
run it in a shell
!info import
!info openvpn
heh cool
i still cannot follow. it does print all running commands... what are you trying to tell me?
blah.. you can find which program is running when you press alt prt
by looking at the list and just reading thru the args.. do i have to explain more?
ah , ok.. i understand now.... thank you... yes, i'll try that in the future
